problem.markdown:
A person wants to test whether an interaction is a work interaction. He designs a contraption C which will reduce the interaction to the lifting of a weight. Which of the following are acceptable properties of C ?
[x] There is no friction, and the components are massless.
[ ] The volume of C increases for each additional unit of height the mass is raised.
[ ] The contraption C contains a thermodynamic heat engine. [ ] The contraption C contains a hypothetical element Y, whose internal workings are not known and are not specified.
[explanation] Idealizations like assuming something is frictionless, massless is allowed. The state of C cannot change. It can undergo a complete cycle, or not undergo any process, but a change in volume is a change in the state of C. C cannot contain something defined in thermodynamics, only something defined in other branches of physics. C cannot contain any black box elements, the working and design of everything must be known and completely specified. [explanation]
